tit.cmt: 他の氏名表記と合わせるため、noの後は最初の一文字のみ大文字としました。

sen.j: 谷根麻呂（たにのねまろ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TANI no NE Maro (year of birth and death unknown) was one historical figure in the Asuka Period.
TANI no Ne Maro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨(他のファイル）に合わせました。
sen.e: TANI no Ne Maro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary way of reading, it was read the same way.
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき大海人皇子（天武天皇）側につき、河内国から倭（大和国）に来る敵を防いで連戦したが、およばず退いた。
sen.e: Having taken sides with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) at the Jinshin War in 672 and although having had many battles to defend Yamato Province against the enemy coming from Kawachi Province, TANI was forced to retreat.

In the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, TANI fought for Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and participated in a series of wars to defend the enemy from Kawachi Province to Yamato (Yamato Province), but he was forced to retreat.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨(他のファイル）に合わせました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, TANI fought for Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and participated in a series of wars to defend the enemy from Kawachi Province to Yamato (Yamato Province), but he was forced to retreat.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月29日に倭で挙兵した大伴吹負は、北進して及楽（奈良市）に向かった。
sen.e: On July 2, 672 (the year of Mizunoe-Saru, one of the Oriental Zodiac), OTOMO no Fukei took arms in Yamato Province and headed to Kyuraku (NARA City).
On August 1, 672, OTOMO no Fukei and his troops rose in arms in Yamato and headed for north, Nara (NARA City).
sen.cmt: 天武天皇元年6月29日は西暦672年8月1日です。及楽：読みは「なら」としています。
sen.e: On August 1, 672, OTOMO no Fukei and his troops rose in arms in Yamato and headed for north, Nara (NARA City).

sen.j: その途中、おそらく7月3日に、河内から大軍が来たという情報を稗田で得た。
sen.e: On the way, probably on July 6, at Hieda, they obtained information that a large forces would come from Kawachi Province.
In Hieda, on his way to Nara, probably on August 4, 672, Fukei got the information of the invasion of a large enemy force coming from Kawachi Province.
sen.cmt: 天武天皇元年7月3日は西暦672年8月4日です。
sen.e: In Hieda, on his way to Nara, probably on August 4, 672, Fukei got the information of the invasion of a large enemy force coming from Kawachi Province.

sen.j: 吹負は数百人ずつの3隊を分派して守備につかせた。
sen.e: Fukei organized three military units of some hundred members each and dispatched them to defend the district.
Fukei organized three military units comprised of some hundred members for each and dispatched them for the defense.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨(他のファイル）に合わせました。
sen.e: Fukei organized three military units comprised of some hundred members for each and dispatched them for the defense.

sen.j: そのうち、竜田に向かった300人の指揮官が、坂本財、長尾真墨、倉墻麻呂、民小鮪、谷根麻呂であった。
sen.e: The commanders of the unit of three hundred heading to Tatsuda were SAKAMOTO no Takara, NAGAO no Masumi, KURAKAKI no Maro, 民小鮪 TANI no NE Maro.
sen.cmt: 民小鮪 読み方不明
sen.e: SAKAMOTO no Takara, NAGAO no Masumi, KURAKAKI no Maro, TAMI no Oshibi, and TANI no Ne Maro were involved in the troops as the commanders of the 300-member unit that headed for Tatsuta.
SAKAMOTO no Takara, NAGAO no Masumi, KURAKAKI no Maro, TAMI no Oshibi, and TANI no Ne Maro were involved in the troops as the commanders of the 300-member unit that headed for Tatsuta.

sen.j: 彼らはその日平石野に宿営したが、高安城に敵軍がいると聞いてその山に登った。
sen.e: After they set up camp at Hiraishino on the same day, with obtaining information that the enemy was in Takayasu Castle which was located in mountain, they climbed the mountain to fight against them.

After they set up camps at Hiraishino on the same day, the commanders were informed that there was the enemy in Takayasunoki Castle, so they climbed the mountain where the castle was located to attack the enemy.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨(他のファイル）に合わせました。
sen.e: After they set up camps at Hiraishino on the same day, the commanders were informed that there was the enemy in Takayasunoki Castle, so they climbed the mountain where the castle was located to attack the enemy.

sen.j: 近江軍（弘文天皇側の軍）は税倉を焼いて逃げた。
sen.e: Omi forces (the army on the Emperor Kobun's side) fled from the castle setting fire to storehouses.
Omi forces (the army on the Emperor Kobun's side) fled from the castle after setting fire to storehouses.
Omi forces (the army on the Emperor Kobun's side) fled from the castle after setting fire to storehouses.

sen.j: 翌日（3日か）の朝、彼らは、西方の大津・丹比の両道に壱伎韓国が率いる大軍を見た。
sen.e: In the next morning (6th), they saw a large force in command of Republic Korea along both Otsu and Tajihi streets in the west.
In the next morning (5th) they saw a large enemy force led by IKI no Karakuni approaching from both Otsu-chi Road and Tajihi-michi Road which were located on the west side of the castle.
sen.cmt: 「翌日」は「7月4日」と考え、（3日か）は割愛しています。西暦672年8月5日としています。大津・丹比：大津道、丹比道と解釈しました。壱伎韓国：いきのからくに以下「韓国」は「かんこく」ではなく人名「からくに」と解釈しました。
sen.e: In the next morning (5th) they saw a large enemy force led by IKI no Karakuni approaching from both Otsu-chi Road and Tajihi-michi Road which were located on the west side of the castle.

sen.j: 城から下って衛我河を渡り、川の西で戦った。
sen.e: After coming down from the castle and crossing the Eiga gawa-river, they had a battle in the west of the river.
They left the castle and advanced the troops across Egakawa River, and the battle broke out on the west side of the river.
They left the castle and advanced the troops across Egakawa River, and the battle broke out on the west side of the river.

sen.j: 敗れて懼坂に用意しておいた陣営に退いた。
sen.e: However, they were defeated in the battle retreating to the camp which have been arranged in 懼坂 beforehand.
However, they were defeated and gathered at the camp which had been set up in Kashikosaka after the withdrawal.
However, they were defeated and gathered at the camp which had been set up in Kashikosaka after the withdrawal.

sen.j: しかし、勝った韓国軍の側では、河内国司守来目塩籠が大海人皇子側にくみするために軍を集めていた。
sen.e: On the side of the victorious Korean army however, Shiogori KUME the governor of Kawachi Province
Among the troops of Karakuni, the winner, KUME no Shioko, Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province), was gathering the troops to take the side of Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: 来目塩籠：くめのしおこ
sen.e: Among the troops of Karakuni, the winner, KUME no Shioko, Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province), was gathering the troops to take the side of Prince Oama.

sen.j: この計画は韓国に知られ、失敗を悟った塩籠は自殺した。
sen.e: Knowing this plot failed, Shiogori committed suicide.
Karakuni detected Shioko's betrayal, and Shioko committed suicide knowing that his plot was failed.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨(他のファイル）に合わせました。
sen.e: Karakuni detected Shioko's betrayal, and Shioko committed suicide knowing that his plot was failed.

sen.j: 中一日をおいて、おそらく5日に、近江軍がいくつもの道から押し寄せてきたため、退却した。
sen.e: The day after tomorrow, possibly on 8, they were forced to retreat, since Omi forces were coming from many ways.
Two days later, probably on 7, the commanders decided to pull out their troops as they saw Omi forces attacking from every direction.
sen.cmt: 日付は「7月6日」と考え、西暦672年8月7日としています。
sen.e: Two days later, probably on 7, the commanders decided to pull out their troops as they saw Omi forces attacking from every direction.

sen.j: 谷根麻呂はこの後も大友吹負のもとで戦ったと考えられるが、その様子は『日本書紀』に現れない。
sen.e: TANI no NE Maro was believed to have continued fighting under OTOMO no Fukei however nothing of his story appeared in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
TANI no Ne Maro was believed to have continued fighting for OTOMO no Fukei after this battle, but nothing was mentioned about him in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨(他のファイル）に合わせました。
sen.e: TANI no Ne Maro was believed to have continued fighting for OTOMO no Fukei after this battle, but nothing was mentioned about him in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
